body: @santosh  can you review this? Because I see you did approve but nothing happened 🤔

> The Discord Server [link](https://discord.com/invite/8RaNF6EX) opens a discord error page stating:-
> "Invite Invalid"
> "This invite may be expired, or you might not have permission to join"
> 
> Also tried opening the link in Incognito Mode. Didn't work.

Uh, sorry, it happened because I didn't configured the invite to stay forever. I'm editing to a new invite for this pr.
@geraintcjy please approve this again... Sorry for the inconveniences caused.
@marsonya pls approve this is you can...
@sergeycrisp please **MERGE** it! I'm waiting for so much time!

Hi everyone, sorry about that. I can get this merges here. It is possible to change the welcome message the link gives? Right now it is "Programmer 😎 has invites you to join Express JS".

I'm thinking the logo should ideally be the ExpressJS logo instead of the JS logo (do we hace the rights to use the JS logo there?). We should also style "Express JS" consistent with the way the project writes it -- either just "Express" or "Express.js". I'm also not sure about whatever the anime logo that is above it, could probably just make that the Express logo, actually.

What do folks think? Otherwise I think it looks good 👍

@dougwilson it says my name "progamer 😎" because I made the invite link... If you agree with discord that, that server is official discord server of express, discord will give us custom invite link which won't say "<name> invited you" stuff..
Also about the logo, yeah I know js logo looks bad... But I don't have a square expressjs logo to give for server logo
Feel free to give me server logo, name and everything as you want. Alternatively you can join discord actually and then I will give you admin role to do the job 🤷🏻‍♂️ @dougwilson
@dougwilson P.S. that anime image is my profile picture on discord lol 😂

I'm waiting since 1/2 hr @dougwilson still u don't come alive... It's midnight here and I'm waiting for the second it would get merge so I can do a shoutout to all those 7 dead people in the server...
Please merge it fast...
Nvm I am making a new logo for expressjs server which will be a square and not long image

Let's just use the existing logo for consistency

Thanks moni!
Done
@dougwilson approve and merge it...
@dougwilson approve and merge it...

There's already a pretty active Discord server for Node (mainly on topic of using it as a web server, such as with Express). https://discord.gg/vUsrbjd
Doesn't seem necessary to have another Discord server.

> There's already a pretty active Discord server for Node (mainly on topic of using it as a web server, such as with Express). https://discord.gg/vUsrbjd
> Doesn't seem necessary to have another Discord server.

😑 We want an "official" support server, not a nodejs help server that even isn't official...
![triggered](https://c.tenor.com/TaYFoLfYiJ8AAAAM/triggered-soldier.gif)

I'm gonna get mad... The DISCORD SERVER DOESN'T NEED ANY NEW COMMUNITY HELPERS, THE MEMBERS THERE CAN HELP EACH OTHER'S. Also due to the high amount of messages sent in discord, it's impossible to list any message in google. Instead, discord has its own search engine, with various features.
Also for you and other guys who don't want discord server -
IF YOU HATE DISCORD, ITS NOT ONE OF OUR PROBLEMS! JUST KEEP QUIET AND MOVE ON.. You're all just popping up and making the queue to approve this request more longer.
I would stop talking about discord if google groups is closed. Just because google groups is too old/not popular and doesn't have all the features like in discord.
@aravindvnair99 ^
Tbh, every app has its pros and cons. You shouldn't just judge it based on its cons

> I'm waiting since 1/2 hr @dougwilson still u don't come alive... It's midnight here and I'm waiting for the second it would get merge so I can do a shoutout to all those 7 dead people in the server...
Please merge it fast... (Quoted from https://github.com/expressjs/express/pull/4520#issuecomment-798740463)
> @dougwilson approve and merge it... (Quoted from https://github.com/expressjs/express/pull/4520#issuecomment-798945564)
> @dougwilson approve and merge it... (Quoted from https://github.com/expressjs/express/pull/4520#issuecomment-798945575)
> 😑 We want an "official" support server, not a nodejs help server that even isn't official... (Quoted from https://github.com/expressjs/express/pull/4520#issuecomment-816527152)
> I'm gonna get mad... (Quoted from https://github.com/expressjs/express/pull/4520#issuecomment-820616129)

Hey @sayantan300, I think you need to be a bit more polite and considerate. But anyways, replying to the other parts of your response...

> The DISCORD SERVER DOESN'T NEED ANY NEW COMMUNITY HELPERS, THE MEMBERS THERE CAN HELP EACH OTHER'S.

If that's the case, it could be self-sustained the way it already is. That still doesn't answer my question either. That wasn't my question in the first place too! Also, as @samsch rightly pointed out at https://github.com/expressjs/express/pull/4520#issuecomment-816262797, an even more active server exists.

Here's the link he gave: https://discord.gg/vUsrbjd So **_even if_** Discord should be added, that should be the link in my opinion.

>Also due to the high amount of messages sent in discord, it's impossible to list any message in google. Instead, discord has its own search engine, with various features.

That's not right. I wasn't referring to Google, but since you mentioned it, Google is well capable of indexing, and they have sufficient computing power to do so. Not a big deal. In fact, Google indexes Telegram. The actual reason is that Discord doesn't allow access as you need to be signed in.

> Also for you and other guys who don't want discord server -

I never said `I don't want Discord`. All I'm asking you is for some clarification on why you feel it's more useful than GitHub Discussions as I mentioned in my [previous message](https://github.com/expressjs/express/pull/4520#pullrequestreview-635023831):
```
Having too many platforms make it hard not only for maintainers to respond but also for developers/programmers to search things for. Also, Discord isn't indexed by search engines. It's a closed space and ideally meant for gamers and hackathons.

In fact, since GitHub Discussions already exists, it's a major boon for developers/programmers considering how much GitHub is used anyways and it's also indexed by search engines.
```

> IF YOU HATE DISCORD, ITS NOT ONE OF OUR PROBLEMS! JUST KEEP QUIET AND MOVE ON.. You're all just popping up and making the queue to approve this request more longer.

I never said I hate it either. In fact I'm an active user of Discord and also a part of 35 different communities currently. So yes, I did do my part of the research. And also, to add on, just like you, everyone is entitled to their opinion. So, saying `JUST KEEP QUIET AND MOVE ON` is simply not right.

> I would stop talking about discord if google groups is closed. Just because google groups is too old/not popular and doesn't have all the features like in discord.

I'm not asking you to stop talking. I'm interested in having the conversation with you rather, by asking why not GitHub Discussions over Discord? To quote me again:

```
Having too many platforms make it hard not only for maintainers to respond but also for developers/programmers to search things for. Also, Discord isn't indexed by search engines. It's a closed space and ideally meant for gamers and hackathons.

In fact, since GitHub Discussions already exists, it's a major boon for developers/programmers considering how much GitHub is used anyways and it's also indexed by search engines.
```

Hmm... Sorry for getting angry that time, but you see, @dougwilson just pop out to ask me, and when I replied, he just didn't came back... I even waited till 3am because getting this approved was very important for me. I just don't want any disputes/questions about it here, because when he sees it, he comments something and goes away... If you want to ask me about something, please talk to me on discord or any other place you prefer, but not in this pull request or issue, because it is taking more time like you have seen above @aravindvnair99

This feels totally unnecessary.
`1.` There are quite a few large communities where solutions are instantly offered for questions regarding express.js such as 
Programmer's Hangout: https://discord.gg/programming (84K users)
Coding Den: https://discord.gg/code (54K users, discord partnered)
Also the server for Nodejs https://discord.gg/vUsrbjd (as said above by samch)

`2.` The whole behaviour of the thread indicates the sole reason for sayatan300 to propose the idea is to own a big server/verified server but not really to provide actual support. 
If you are planning to verify the server,
it would be convincing if the ownership would be passed to an official member of the express.js team or to let a matured adult handle such an important server.
else the listing in the readme is not required at all.

Personally, I've been using discord for 2 years. All my doubts regarding express.js are cleared by volunteers from Programmer's Hangout. But it would be a lot helpful if official support is available on Discord.
